intro: Isocarpha glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf isocarpha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves that are usually hairless. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Isocarpha glabrata is often found in scrub and desert grassland ecosystems.
